channel.title: Posts on K.T.H.
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on K.T.H.

item.title: Touch my toes with yours
item.description:
The whimsy of tattoos, hot girl summer, small talk which is hot, smart, and tamely grunge. Fierce belief in pop culture as ≠ garbage.

I. Tendrils II. Flimsy grocery bags III. Violated by capitalism IV. Safe in my own skin

item.title: Duo is crying!
item.description:
Duo the owl hasn’t seen you in awhile… do you still want to learn vietnamese? Take a 5 minute lesson now! Maybe the world doesn’t so selfishly belong to you to desctibe.

I. Let’s be symbiotic II. Unfogging a window III. Prime directive

item.title: Part-time summer at the bakery
item.description:
The backdrop is the summer between college and my first full time job. An exploration of cyclothymia and the stuff that runs through family trees and friend group chats when you just. can’t. stop. running. away.

I. Shower thoughts II. Tidepool poem III. Is suicide an abnormal psychology IV. Pina colada

item.title: Eat poop
item.description: Is the world a work of art? Would you rather eat poop that tastes like food or food that tastes like poop? Is ethical consumerism possible?

item.title: I'm a stranger here myself
item.description:
My first language was Vietnamese. For the rules of English lexicon clouding my head, I cannot write in my first language. A treatise on hyphenated identities.

I. Spongebrain mixed media II. Viet-American adolescence i. estrangement ii. terminal uniqueness iii. intercultural shifting

item.title: High tide
item.description:
Tangential thoughts down the central coast of California: solo trip before my last year of college. I try tinder. Scrolling and sobbing. I find a dying seal.

I. To swim with a seal II. We are giant livers

item.title: Adventures in glitch pop
item.description:
Some experiments of mine in logic pro, fl studio, and audacity.

I. Beachwave II. Miles and miles III. Is it by mistake or design

item.title: Memoir
item.description:
Floundering at 20. Memory, adolescence, and the relationships daughters and mothers can grow to share. My hippocampus in a jar of acid.

I. Abstract II. Semicircular canal III. Arms as wings IV. Mind’s eye V. Esophagus VI. Cotton mouth VII. Heart

item.title: College major
item.description:
One slice of theory & methods in the american studies field. Reflection, senior thesis proposal on public transport and environmental racism in my backyard.

I. My view of the field II. Senior thesis design III. Goals + significance

item.title: A luddite snapchats
item.description:
I made a snapchat and for 3 months decided to document my learnings in california through the app’s story and memories features.

I. Vlog II. Stats

item.title: Postscript: on the californian road
item.description: After 3 months on the californian road at 19.

item.title: On infinity
item.description: I have been fascinated with the idea of ‘small’ and ‘big’ infinities for awhile.

item.title: Walk home with a sprained ankle
item.description:
Hard years– flashbacks and forwards of high school letters, cross country runs. So fragile my teammates carried me from twisted branch and sunken stone, as I melted to jelly.

I. Coping mechanisms II. Stab at a poem III. Slow run

item.title: 500 words or less
item.description: Carleton is powered by wind turbines. What empowers you?

item.title: Getting angry on skype
item.description: Words flying over skype to my best friend james in anger and disgust with American high school, white privilege and whitened beauty standards. deliciously naive.
